title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 713-4.10 - Details and finishes

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 713-4.10 - Details and finishes

State Regulations
(a) Doors to
all rooms containing bathtubs, sitz baths, showers and toilets for resident use
shall be hinged or sliding. When such rooms have only one opening, the door
shall be designed to be opened without need to push against a resident who may
have collapsed within the room. (b) The minimum width of all openings to rooms needing access for beds or
stretchers shall be at minimum three feet eight inches. (c) Floors in wet areas, such as
bathing/shower facilities, shall be pitched to floor drains to prevent any
run-off to areas outside the room. (d) Acoustical treatment shall be provided
between corridors in resident areas, nurse's stations, dayrooms, recreation
rooms, dining areas and waiting areas and resident rooms to reduce ambient
noise in resident living and sleeping areas. The STC (sound transmission
classification) between those spaces shall not be less than 51 and the NRC
(noise reduction coefficient) shall not be less than 65 for ceilings in those
spaces. Notes
